intro: Neohouzeaua tavoyana, commonly known as the Tavoyan fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Blechnaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, pinnately divided fronds that are typically light green in color. The plant produces spores in small, clustered sori located on the underside of the fronds. Neohouzeaua tavoyana is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in regions like Thailand and Malaysia. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often growing in forest understories.
